intro: Apatostelis ciliaris, commonly known as the coastal flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Compositae and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal environments, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. It is well adapted to salt spray and strong winds, making it a hardy species. Apatostelis ciliaris plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal dunes and providing habitat for native insects.
